title: Choosing roles for new champion select
body:
I'm sick of the 30-40 min queue times for bronze top/jungle in the new champion select so I'm looking a revising my roles. Unfortunately I burned myself out on support awhile back and so picking it as secondary and playing it every game is not attractive.

What are the second and third least popular roles. Currently thinking that the order goes something like mid>top/jungle>adc>sup. Did a bit of googling but found nothing definitive.

Probably not an ideal way of choosing a role but its that or give Dota2 a go.

replies.body: 30-40 min queues? Wtf. I queue mid/top and get into games in 4-7 minutes. Top is definitely in lower demand than jungle.

Sounds about right.  mid>top/jungle>adc>sup. 
ADC and JG are probably interchangeable, especially in lower elos. 

Best way to get your fave role everygame and not have to suffer through queue times is  [to find some friends to play with](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment). You build relationships, can learn to fit with each others play styles, have A+ communication and avoid toxins like feeders/afks/general potatoes. With all of the incentives being thrown at you such as, increased IP, mastery points and hex tech stuff, there is literally nothing to lose ♥

Not so easy to just find people to play with, playing with, ehh by myself is just easier. I sometimes play around evening time, sometimes morning, other times after midnight. There is no way I can find a handful of players who are playing at the same times I do, not possible.

In cases like this (I am like this as well), its about having _ enough _ friends. I have a maxed out friends list, with at least 30 players on and ready to play at any hour of the day. This is also helped by the number of chatrooms i'm in (Looking for group, noob, gameplay & strategy, + a bunch of personal ones). 

You can start by growing your own friends list. 

* Put an add up in [team recruitment](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment) for silver players
* Max out the [clubs](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/clubs) you can join
* Add nice players after a game
* Hang out in the in-client chatrooms
* Join some of the groups on facebook

For scheduling ranked games with some mates, I would suggest using[ doodle](http://doodle.com/).

I DO have friends on my friends list. The problem is that they come off my friends list faster than I put them on there.

I get one good game with someone, add them as a friend, play another game, take them off.

It is the same scenario over and over and over for me. Someone has ONE good game and that is it, after that their true colours show and I see how bad they really are. I even got to the point I had one of my 'friends' tell me "I'm sorry I am worse than you, I am only Bronze". NEWS FLASH - I was only Bronze at the time also. He went something like 0/8 early in bot whilst I was 1/0 top, yet we were the same rank.

It is a hit and miss adding friends because they just need that one good game for others to think they are any decent. In fact, this whole game is a hit and miss with how Matchmaking works.
May have to try adc/jgl. See if that improves things.
I play support almost every game I don't see what is wrong with it.
Nothing wrong with it. I just burned myself out on it last season and don't have fun in the role anymore.
